intro: Cordia somaliensis, commonly known as Somali white cedar, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, leathery leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is valued for its durable wood and has traditional uses in local communities.
